reasoningText.text:
The user wants me to migrate a Java project from Java 8 to Java 17. Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

My approach will be:
1. First, explore the repository structure
2. Look at the pom.xml or build.gradle files to understand the build configuration
3. Update Java version configurations
4. Run `mvn clean verify` to see if there are any issues
5. Fix any compatibility issues that arise
6. Continue until `mvn clean verify` passes

I can see the issue. The problem is that in Spring Boot 2.7.x, there was a change in the initialization order of scripts. The data.sql script is being executed before Hibernate creates the tables (schema.sql). This is a known issue when migrating to newer Spring Boot versions.

Let me check if there are SQL initialization files:
/tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/Master-Java-Unit-Testing-with-Spring-Boot-and-Mockito/src/main/resources/data.sql

Directory structure displayed in console.

spring.h2.console.enabled=true

The issue is that in Spring Boot 2.5+, the script-based DataSource initialization (data.sql) is executed before Hibernate initializes the schema. We need to configure Spring Boot to defer the execution until after Hibernate creates the tables. Let's add the necessary configuration:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/Master-Java-Unit-Testing-with-Spring-Boot-and-Mockito/src/main/resources/application.properties
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string: spring.jpa.show-sql=true
spring.h2.console.enabled=true
New string: spring.jpa.show-sql=true
spring.h2.console.enabled=true
spring.jpa.defer-datasource-initialization=true
